newsitem.title: BELARUS: Belarus to privatise agricultural, sugar factories.
newsitem.headline: Belarus to privatise agricultural, sugar factories.

text.p: Belarus plans to privatise its agricultural processing industry including four sugar refineries but the state will have a "golden" controlling stake in enterprises, deputy agriculture ministry Ivan Shakolo said on Friday.
"This year all processing (plants) in the hands of the state will be privatised and golden state shares introduced to keep control of the sector," Shakolo told Reuters in an interview.
Shakolo said the finance ministry was working out a scheme for the golden shares to be issued and more than 500 enterprises, including all four sugar refineries, would be privatised.
He said the state had lost a "controlling and even a blocking stake" in many big enterprises when half the sector, which needed $1.5 billion investment, was privatised last year.

The ownership structure of 120 big agricultural enterprises would be changed this year against 80 last year "so that every region of Belarus has one example of modern agricultural management," he added.
